titleStmt.title: Mythomystes wherein a short suruay is taken of the nature and value of true poesy and depth of the ancients above our moderne poets. To which is annexed the tale of Narcissus briefly mythologized
titleStmt.author: Reynolds, Henry, fl. 1627-1632.
Ovid, 43 B.C.-17 or 18 A.D. Metamorphoses.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by George Purslowe] for Henry Seyle, at the Tigers-head in St. Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Dedication signed: H:R:, i.e. Henry Reynolds.
Printer's name and date of publication from STC.
"The tale of Narcissus", in verse, is paraphrased from Giovanni Andrea dell' Anguillara's version of the story from Ovid's "Metamorphoses".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
